column2: @quadzillatd @Keyes_Tanner @RTFKTstudios They are the same, I put more on polygon so people could avoid high gas fees. The price difference is because the items on eth have sold out, and you are seeing the price that people are listing for re-sale.

For anyone that missed my previous videos, here is an installation video and a clip showing how to access the basketball court rooftop. Use size 310 + line up the window frame. In preview mode - use the space bar to jump up on to the kitchen counter + walk up the sloped section. https://t.co/nLSXb1clgb

@Nftydaddy @ape2251 @RTFKTstudios Here is an installation video and a clip showing how to access the rooftop. Use size 310 on oncyber and line up the window frame. When you go through to preview mode - use the space bar to jump up on to the kitchen counter and then walk up the sloped section. https://t.co/wQHKtp3QCO
@Nftydaddy @ape2251 @RTFKTstudios I have shown this in a previous video for the first roof terrace, but can record a new one today if that would be helpful.

@Nftydaddy @ape2251 @RTFKTstudios Hey, you can add it to any asset placeholder, just line the window frame/reveal up in the model with the space pod window as per the installation video. To access the roof, jump onto the kitchen counter using the space bar and walk up the ramped section.

@Keyes_Tanner @RTFKTstudios Hey, The 100 are the ones I made available on ETH. The 400 are the ones I made available on Polygon. I minted 500 on Friday in total last Friday which will be the total supply.

@willykta @RTFKTstudios Hi, if you make sure the Size is 310 on oncyber then use the window reveal/ frame in the basketball court model to line up with the exterior of the space pod window (the window by the seating), then it will fit above the roof of the spacepod. https://t.co/J9sR9tEQwT

@yondon92 @RTFKTstudios You can add it to the roof of the space pod. If you size it to 310 on oncyber and then line up the window reveal / frame on the model with the window of the space pod. https://t.co/geq5D6VpOt

@alexktep No, at the moment you cannot move between the 2 second floors. Currently on the second floor you can only walk on the original space pod roof area.

@alexktep Wow, looks like you are building a mini city! Yes the base that I am airdropping tomorrow will be on the same level as the main space pod. There isn't a way to move between the two first floor levels shown on your picture, currently you can only walk on the roof of the space pod
